page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: Staindrop is one of County Durham's green villages and there has been some form of settlement here for many hundreds of years, which is borne out by the Saxon foundations and parts of the present church. later in 1378, a market charter was granted which shows settlement at tha time. Earliest houses date back to the 16th and early 17th century, housing having moved westward from the church to around the green. Many houses date from the 18th century. Many of the cottages and houses in the village were and still are owned by Lord Barnard of Raby Estate. This is born out by the crown emblem which is found on many of the houses. Houses in the village were built from local sandstone, with stone tiled roofs. Some of these houses have been modernised, but every effort has been
